1.text: Therefore thou art inexcusable, O man, every one judging: for in what thou judgest another, thou condemnest thyself; for thou judging doest the same.

2.text: And we know that the judgment of God is according to truth upon them doing such things.

3.text: And thinkest thou this, O man, judging them doing such things, and doing the same, that thou shalt escape the judgment of God?

4.text: Or the abundance of his goodness and forbearance and long suffering dost thou despise; not knowing that the goodness of God brings thee to repentance?

5.text: And according to thy hardness and impenitent heart thou treasurest up to thyself anger in the day of anger and revelation of the just judgment of God;

6.text: Who will give back to each according to his works:

7.text: To them truly by perseverance of the good work they seek glory and honour and immortality, eternal life:

8.text: But to them of intrigue, and are truly disobedient to the truth, and yielding to injustice, anger and wrath,

9.text: Affliction and distress, upon every soul of man working evil, both of the Jew first, and of the Greek;

10.text: But glory, and honour, and peace, to every one working good, both to the Jew first, and to the Greek:

11.text: For there is no distinction of persons with God.

12.text: For as many as sinned without law shall also perish without law: and as many as sinned in the law shall be judged by the law;

13.text: (For not hearers of the law just with God, but the doers of the law shall be justified.

14.text: For when nations, not having the things of the law, by nature do the things of the law, these, not having the law, are law to themselves:

15.text: Which show the work of the law Written in their hearts, their consciousness testifying together, and between one another thoughts accusing or also excusing;)

16.text: In the day when God shall judge the concealed things of men according to my good news by Jesus Christ.

17.text: Behold, thou art named a Jew, and restest upon the law, and boastest thyself in God,

18.text: And knowest the will, and triest things differing, being sounded out of the law;

19.text: And art persuaded thou thyself to be a guide of the blind, a light of them in darkness,

20.text: An instructor of the foolish, a teacher of the inexperienced, having the form of knowledge and of truth in the law.

21.text: Therefore teaching another, teachest thou not thyself proclaiming not to steal, stealest thou?

22.text: Speaking not to commit adultery, committest thou adultery? abhorring images, committest thou sacrilege?

23.text: Thou who boastest in the law, by transgression of the law dishonourest thou God?

24.text: For the name of God by you is blasphemed in the nations, as it has been written.

25.text: For truly circumcision profits, if thou do the law: and if thou be a transgressor of the law, thy circumcision has become uncircumcision.

26.text: Therefore if uncircumcision watch the justification of the law, shall not his uncircumcision be reckoned for circumcision?

27.text: And shall not uncircumcision by nature, completing the law, judge thee, which by letter and circumcision a transgressor of the law?

28.text: For he in appearance, is not a Jew; neither circumcision, in appearance in the flesh:

29.text: But he in concealment, a Jew; and circumcision of the heart, in spirit, not in letter; whose approbation not of man, but of God.
